channel.title: Comments on: Memorial for Yoske Achituv by Yehudah Mirsky
channel.description: notes on Jewish theology and spirituality

item.title: By: Abe Kohen
item.dc:creator: Abe Kohen
item.description: I didn't know the man and have nothing to say about him. However, a kibbutz, whether dati or not, is still a failed communist society. I visited two of them, Tirat Tzvi and Shluchot (near Bet She'an) a long time ago. Visit isn't the right word. Conscripted into forced labor was more like it. For some unknown reason, my dati agricultural high school classmates and I were forced to work for food and shelter at the above kibbutzim. Shluchot with its stinking farmed fish. Tirat Tzvi with its turkeys. Not a fan of kibbutzim.
item.content:encoded: I didn’t know the man and have nothing to say about him. However, a kibbutz, whether dati or not, is still a failed communist society. I visited two of them, Tirat Tzvi and Shluchot (near Bet She’an) a long time ago. Visit isn’t the right word. Conscripted into forced labor was more like it. For some unknown reason, my dati agricultural high school classmates and I were forced to work for food and shelter at the above kibbutzim. Shluchot with its stinking farmed fish. Tirat Tzvi with its turkeys. Not a fan of kibbutzim.
